Tasks.Task: Create and configure Azure Blob Storage
Tasks.Task Description: Create a new Azure Blob Storage account and configure it according to your project requirements. This includes setting up containers and defining access policies.
Retrieve and set environment variables to connect to the storage account, Computer Vision, and Cosmos DB services.
Install the Azure Blob Storage client library and Azure Identity client library using the appropriate package manager for your programming language (e.g., npm for JavaScript, pip for Python).

Tasks.Task: Implement Blob Storage triggers and bindings
Tasks.Task Description: Define triggers and bindings in your Azure Function to handle blob storage events, such as file uploads.
Implement functionality to analyze uploaded blobs using the Computer Vision service and process the results.

Tasks.Task: Insert analyzed data into Cosmos DB
Tasks.Task Description: Use output bindings to insert the analyzed image text, as a JSON object, into Cosmos DB.
Use Visual Studio Code or the Azure CLI to deploy your function to Azure, ensuring it is properly connected to the Blob Storage and other services.
Use Azure's cost management features to set budgets, monitor costs, and optimize your storage account to ensure you only pay for what you need.
Ensure that appropriate security measures are in place, such as using managed identities for authentication and setting up role-based access control (RBAC).
Use Visual Studio Code to run and test the function locally before deploying it to Azure.
Configure event-based triggers using Azure Event Grid to react to blob storage events such as creation and deletion of blobs.
Define conditions and operations for a storage task to perform on blobs in an Azure Storage account.
Implement BlobFuse2 to mount Azure Blob Storage as a file system on Linux using the libfuse library.
Use tools like Miria to migrate data to Azure Blob Storage, ensuring proper configuration and monitoring of the migration process.
